pokedex_entries.scarlet: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
pokedex_entries.violet: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
pokedex_entries.violet: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax’s strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
pokedex_entries.violet: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
pokedex_entries.violet: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt’s belly-button dynamo.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Big Pecks2. Keen EyeRocky Payload (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
pokedex_entries.violet: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
pokedex_entries.violet: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokémon will bury an entire town.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
pokedex_entries.violet: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
pokedex_entries.violet: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokémon’s evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Thick Fat2. Slush RushSheer Force (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
pokedex_entries.violet: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Thick Fat2. Snow CloakSheer Force (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
pokedex_entries.violet: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
pokedex_entries.violet: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
pokedex_entries.violet: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
pokedex_entries.violet: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.
pokedex_entries.violet: The valve in Crocalor’s flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
pokedex_entries.violet: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The rider’s body heat warms Cyclizar’s back and lifts the Pokémon’s spirit.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
pokedex_entries.violet: The surface of this Pokémon’s skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
pokedex_entries.violet: It basks in the sun to its heart’s content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.violet: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
pokedex_entries.violet: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
pokedex_entries.violet: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Cud Chew2. Armor TailSap Sipper (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
pokedex_entries.violet: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.
pokedex_entries.violet: The yeast in Fidough’s breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokémon has been protected by people since long ago.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
pokedex_entries.violet: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as “synchronizing,” an entire flock of these Pokémon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
pokedex_entries.violet: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
pokedex_entries.violet: The hardness of Floragato’s fur depends on the Pokémon’s mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
pokedex_entries.violet: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecoco’s head and flickers to and fro.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
pokedex_entries.violet: Many Pokémon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
pokedex_entries.violet: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
pokedex_entries.violet: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
pokedex_entries.violet: Glimmet’s toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
pokedex_entries.violet: Glimmora’s petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
pokedex_entries.violet: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
pokedex_entries.violet: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: This friendly Pokémon doesn’t like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
pokedex_entries.violet: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn’t like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
pokedex_entries.violet: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
pokedex_entries.violet: It’s possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
pokedex_entries.violet: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with an object described in an old book.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
pokedex_entries.violet: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
pokedex_entries.violet: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
pokedex_entries.violet: It’s possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
pokedex_entries.violet: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. There’s hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
pokedex_entries.violet: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it’s not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokémon detest.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
pokedex_entries.violet: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it can’t stay in this mode for long.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
pokedex_entries.violet: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
pokedex_entries.violet: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
pokedex_entries.violet: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize what’s going on.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
pokedex_entries.violet: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
pokedex_entries.violet: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Nacli’s body.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
pokedex_entries.violet: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
pokedex_entries.violet: It’s highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
pokedex_entries.violet: It entrances female Pokémon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
pokedex_entries.violet: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Volt Absorb2. Natural CureIron Fist (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
pokedex_entries.violet: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

pokedex_data.abilities: 1. Volt Absorb2. Natural CureIron Fist (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
pokedex_entries.violet: Pawmot’s fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
pokedex_entries.violet: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
pokedex_entries.violet: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokémon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
pokedex_entries.violet: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
pokedex_entries.violet: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.
pokedex_entries.violet: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
pokedex_entries.violet: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
pokedex_entries.violet: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
pokedex_entries.violet: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
pokedex_entries.violet: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
pokedex_entries.violet: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.
pokedex_entries.violet: Skeledirge’s gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
pokedex_entries.violet: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
pokedex_entries.violet: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokémon is in the sun.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
pokedex_entries.violet: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they’re out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
pokedex_entries.violet: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
pokedex_entries.violet: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.
pokedex_entries.violet: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread’s strength is the topic of ongoing research.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
pokedex_entries.violet: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it’s satisfied with the result.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
pokedex_entries.violet: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
pokedex_entries.violet: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other’s hammers by smashing them together.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
pokedex_entries.violet: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
pokedex_entries.violet: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
pokedex_entries.violet: The steel section is Varoom’s actual body. This Pokémon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
pokedex_entries.violet: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
pokedex_entries.violet: These Pokémon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and they’re a popular delicacy.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
pokedex_entries.violet: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
pokedex_entries.violet: A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.
